TopicTitle: KSP freezes after a few minutes

Articles.Content:
Hi,

Since today KSP completely freezes after a few minutes of play. It makes no difference where I am in the game at that moment, it already froze mid flight and also in the start menu.

I run the 64-bit version of KSP on a Windows 10 machine with an i5-6600K and 32GB RAM. Graphics card is a GTX 1070 with 8 GB VRAM.

I deinstalled all mods and the problem persisted.

One weird thing is that the output log appears to recognize only 3 GB of VRAM

Initialize engine version: 5.4.0p4 (b15b5ae035b7)
GfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1
Direct3D:
    Version:  Direct3D 9.0c [nvd3dum.dll 21.21.13.7619]
    Renderer: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1070
    Vendor:   NVIDIA
    VRAM:     3072 MB (via DXGI)
    Caps:     Shader=30 DepthRT=1 NativeDepth=1 NativeShadow=1 DF16=0 INTZ=1 NULL=1 RESZ=0 SlowINTZ=0 ATOC=1

There is no crash report and I have to manually end KSP in the task manager

The log file gives the following error

[LOG 15:03:09.330] Skipped rendering frame because GfxDevice is in invalid state (device lost)
[ERR 15:03:09.464] D3D device reset failed [queried technique not available]

Maybe someone has an idea what might be the cause of the issue.

2 hours ago, Morgul07 said:

Initialize engine version: 5.4.0p4 (b15b5ae035b7)

Are you using an older version of the game or launch the game through the launcher? Because that engine version is pretty old.

The 3GB limit seems to be either a driver issue or you're actually running a 32bit version of the game. If you're using the launcher the log is not from the game but from the launcher itself, which is still 32bit because it has been abandoned since 2015 and should be avoided at all costs.  For game versions of 1.4 or higher you can find the real output log in "%USERPROFILE%\AppData\LocalLow\Squad\Kerbal Space Program\output_log.txt".

On 7/28/2019 at 11:21 PM, Morgul07 said:

Does nobody have an idea what could be the cause of the issue?

From your log: 

D3D device reset failed [queried technique not available]
 
[LOG 15:02:51.390] Skipped rendering frame because GfxDevice is in invalid state (device lost)

I'd say this is a GPU problem - unstable overclock, flaky card, or driver problem. KSP thinks your graphics card went away.
Could maybe be that something else is interfering in the rendering path, overlays like RivaTuner have been known to screw up KSP. Otherwise, check your temps, check your cables, furmark the card, update your drivers. Usual stuff.

As a real long-shot, you could try playing with the various graphics-related -force-xxx command line switches.
